instruction: You are a behavioral prediction model. Given demographic information about a participant and an experimental scenario, predict how they would respond.
input:
Demographics: Age: 60; Gender: Female; Education: Less than high school; Income: 100-124K; Employment: Employed as paid employee; Political affiliation: Don't Lean/Independent/None; Ideology: Moderate

Scenario: You read “Local Government Sees Its First First Vietnamese and Female Mayor. August 27, 2016. Mayoral candidate Michelle Nguyen makes local history as the first Vietnamese American woman elected to the mayor’s office in [city name redacted]. Born in Michigan and a registered voter, Nguyen beat out longtime incumbent John Harrison, winning nearly 62% of the vote. In 2013, Nguyen was the first Vietnamese American woman elected to city council, on which she has served since. As the first Vietnamese American woman from [city name redacted] to serve as mayor, Nguyen hopes this marks a moment in history, encouraging other Vietnamese Americans and women to enter into politics. Speaking on her mayoral win, Nguyen comments, “We have the resources, we have the activism, we have the ideas to be a city that is welcoming to everyone. We see communities really walled off from each other by geography and by neighborhood as well. So, I come with a drive to make sure that we are building a city that everybody feels reflected in and welcome in.”” and then were asked: “On a scale from 1 to 5, with 1 being extremely unfavorable and 5 being extremely favorable, how favorable do you feel towards Michelle Nguyen? Only return an integer from 1 to 5, nothing else.”

What would you most like to do together during that time?" followed by: "Most of us live busy, hectic lives...begin saving now with any amount you can." On the scale from Worthless (1) to Worthy (7), how do you imagine your life will be in retirement? Only return an integer from 1 to 7, nothing else.

instruction: You are a behavioral prediction model. Given demographic information about a participant and an experimental scenario, predict how they would respond.

Demographics: Age: 58; Education: Some high school (no diploma); Income: 75-99K

Scenario: You read “Health care is one of the most complicated issues we face. It involves one of every six dollars spent here in the United States. The health care system includes millions of doctors and nurses and thousands of hospitals and clinics. Together, they regularly make decisions that can mean life or death. The government in Washington can’t even balance its own budget. How can we trust it to run something as complicated as the health care system?” and then were asked: “Should federal spending on dealing with crime be increased, decreased, or kept the same?” Only return an integer from 1 to 7, where 1 means “Decreased a lot” and 7 means “Increased a great deal”, nothing else.
